title: Build workout tracking app with exercise filtering and weight progress

requirements.text: Implement dark mode UI theme throughout the entire application with appropriate dark backgrounds, light text, and sufficient contrast for readability

quotes: make a workout app in dark mode

acceptanceCriteria: All screens use dark mode color scheme
Text and UI elements have sufficient contrast against dark backgrounds
Interactive elements are clearly visible in dark mode

requirements.text: Create backend data model for Exercise with fields: name (Text), equipmentType (Text: Dumbbell, Barbell, Free Weight, Machine, Plate-Loaded Machine, Cable), muscleGroup (Text: back, chest, biceps, triceps, shoulders, core, lower body)

quotes: filter exercises by equipment type (Dumbbell, Barbell, Free Weight, Machine, Plate-Loaded Machine, and Cable) and muscle group (back, chest, biceps, triceps, shoulders, back, core and lower body)

acceptanceCriteria: Exercise type stores all required fields
Equipment types match the specified list exactly
Muscle groups match the specified list exactly

requirements.text: Create backend data model for Workout with fields: name (Text), exerciseIds (array of exercise references), createdAt (timestamp)
acceptanceCriteria: Workout can reference multiple exercises
Workout stores creation timestamp
Workout has a name field

requirements.text: Create backend data model for WeightEntry with fields: exerciseId (reference to exercise), weight (Nat), reps (Nat), sets (Nat), date (timestamp), workoutId (optional reference to workout)
acceptanceCriteria: Weight entries link to specific exercises
Weight entries store weight, reps, and sets
Weight entries include timestamp for progress tracking
Weight entries can optionally reference a workout session

requirements.text: Implement backend methods to create, read, update, and delete exercises with validation for equipment type and muscle group values
acceptanceCriteria: Can create new exercises
Can retrieve exercise list
Can update existing exercises
Can delete exercises
Equipment type and muscle group values are validated against allowed lists

requirements.text: Implement backend methods to create, read, update, and delete workouts
acceptanceCriteria: Can create new workouts with multiple exercises
Can retrieve workout list
Can update existing workouts
Can delete workouts

requirements.text: Implement backend methods to log weight entries and retrieve weight progress history for a given exercise, sorted by date
acceptanceCriteria: Can log new weight entries for exercises
Can retrieve weight history for a specific exercise
Weight history is sorted by date for progress tracking

requirements.text: Implement backend query method to filter exercises by equipment type, returning exercises that match the specified equipment type

quotes: filter exercises by equipment type (Dumbbell, Barbell, Free Weight, Machine, Plate-Loaded Machine, and Cable)

acceptanceCriteria: Can filter exercises by any of the six equipment types
Returns only exercises matching the specified equipment type

requirements.text: Implement backend query method to filter exercises by muscle group, returning exercises that target the specified muscle group

quotes: muscle group (back, chest, biceps, triceps, shoulders, back, core and lower body)

acceptanceCriteria: Can filter exercises by any of the seven muscle groups
Returns only exercises targeting the specified muscle group

requirements.text: Implement backend query method to return all exercises sorted alphabetically by name
acceptanceCriteria: Exercises are returned in alphabetical order by name
Sorting is case-insensitive

requirements.text: Create exercise library page with filtering UI that allows users to filter by equipment type (dropdown with: Dumbbell, Barbell, Free Weight, Machine, Plate-Loaded Machine, Cable) and muscle group (dropdown with: back, chest, biceps, triceps, shoulders, core, lower body), displaying filtered results alphabetically

quotes: filter exercises by equipment type (Dumbbell, Barbell, Free Weight, Machine, Plate-Loaded Machine, and Cable) and muscle group (back, chest, biceps, triceps, shoulders, back, core and lower body) and organize alphabetically

acceptanceCriteria: Exercise library displays all exercises alphabetically by default
Equipment type filter dropdown includes all six types
Muscle group filter dropdown includes all seven groups
Filtering updates the displayed exercise list in real-time
Filtered results remain alphabetically sorted

requirements.text: Create workout creation/editing page that allows users to name a workout, search and add exercises to it, and save the complete workout
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a workout name
User can search and select exercises to add
User can remove exercises from the workout
User can save the workout
User can edit existing workouts

requirements.text: Create weight logging interface where users can select an exercise, enter weight, reps, and sets, and log the entry with current date/time
acceptanceCriteria: User can select an exercise from a list or search
User can input weight value (numeric)
User can input number of reps (numeric)
User can input number of sets (numeric)
Entry is automatically timestamped with current date/time
User receives confirmation when entry is saved

requirements.text: Create weight progress view that displays historical weight entries for a selected exercise, showing date, weight, reps, and sets in chronological order with visual indication of progress trends
acceptanceCriteria: User can select an exercise to view progress
Historical entries display date, weight, reps, and sets
Entries are sorted chronologically (most recent first)
Visual elements indicate progress trends (increasing/decreasing weight)

requirements.text: Create workouts list page that displays all saved workouts with ability to view workout details (exercises included) and start a workout session
acceptanceCriteria: All saved workouts are displayed
User can tap/click to view workout details
Workout details show all included exercises
User can start a workout session from the list

requirements.text: Seed the backend with a comprehensive starter exercise database including common exercises across all equipment types and muscle groups
acceptanceCriteria: Database includes exercises for each equipment type
Database includes exercises for each muscle group
Exercise names are realistic and commonly used in fitness
Minimum of 30 diverse exercises are seeded

constraints: Equipment types must be exactly: Dumbbell, Barbell, Free Weight, Machine, Plate-Loaded Machine, Cable
Muscle groups must be exactly: back, chest, biceps, triceps, shoulders, core, lower body
All UI must use dark mode color scheme
Exercises must be organized alphabetically in all views
nonGoals: Social features or sharing workouts with other users
Integration with wearable devices or fitness trackers
Advanced analytics or machine learning predictions
